intro: Ochrosperma lineare, commonly known as the slender orchid, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and narrow, linear leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale green flowers arranged in a spike, which bloom during the spring and summer months. It is typically found in coastal heathlands and sandy soils, thriving in well-drained environments. Ochrosperma lineare is a perennial herb that is often used in native gardens for its ornamental value and ecological benefits.
